Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a red pottery vessel, the fabric is relatively coarse and partially mauve and grey in section, the exterior is covered with a thin light-brown slip and faint traces of six lines of Coptic text written in black ink.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394644) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394644)
